titleStmt.title: E. L. Cockrill to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1001

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1863-1867

body.p:
Irvine Estill Co Ky
Nov 6th 1865
To his Excellency
The Gov of Ky.

Whereas on the 30th day of Oct 1865. John and Robert Wiseman of the County of Estill State of Ky did maliciously Shoot and Kill Allen ^Claiborne^ Witt, of Said County, and are now running at large: I do respectfully ask your excellency to offer the lawful reward for the apprehension of Said parties & for their delivery to the civil Authorities of Said County --
E L Cockrill J. E. C. C.

Height about 5 ^ft^ 6^in^, Weight 135 ^lbs^ Dark Complexion. blue eyes dark hair. round shouldered, low Leged -- Scar on one of his breasts where he is supposed to have been shot. is about 34 or 5 years old.
Age about 33 years. Height about 6 feet Weight 165 or 70lbs bow leged ^rather^ Dark Complexion. dark hair. blue eyes. Scar as large as the palm of a hand on the right thigh made by a burn --
E.L Cockrill J. E. C C.

Estill Co
Reward
$500. for John & Robt Wiseman for the murder of Clayton Witt
8th Nov 1865
